website_summaries.verdict: Pleasing to look at and use, with tempered glass features and a long-time warranty.
pros: Hangs any way you want with full functionality
We love the effortless floating look
Includes marker tray and dry-erase marker
cons: Some users experienced issues with the mounting hardware

customer_reviews.title: The dry erase board? GORGEOUS! The hardware they give you? A CRUEL JOKE
customer_reviews.text: So, I have to divide this into two parts.... Part One: The board itself is BEAUTIFUL! It's durable, well made, and I absolutely love how it looks. Part Two: The friggen hardware. HOLY CRAP. Do yourself a favor and THROW AWAY THE WALL ANCHORS this thing comes with. Don't even bother. Go to Home Depot or Lowe's and buy yourself some actual drywall anchors, otherwise you will HATE YOUR LIFE before this thing ever gets hung up on your wall. If you go out and buy better hardware, installation of this will be a BREEZE. We spent 3 hours learning this lesson the hard way. Please, if you do nothing else, HEED MY WARNING! Buy some good drywall anchors!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal CaribbeanTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: EXPLODING GLASSBOARD
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 16 of these in various sizes for our new office. We have had them since July 10th, 2018. In just over 3 months one has literally exploded. Glass is everywhere! Thank goodness, no one was in the office at the time. Very concerned about the other 15 doing the same thing. Obviously I can not recommend this item, wish I could give no stars. Unless you are okay with glass flying everywhere and covering your office, do not take a chance!
customer_reviews.author: Pegasus Resources

customer_reviews.title: Quartet quality is a stinker - DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: you gotta be kidding me - no template for a heavy board. Then, after making a template and getting it on the wall, the weld in the mounts snap due to piss poor quality. I'm not sure what happened to quartet, but this is trash trash trash. don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: David Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Does not erase, makers do not show well, bends on long end
customer_reviews.text: The only two thing good about the board (black) is that it looks great when clean and I like the magnet, but... The cons: 1. The board is ridiculously hard to erase. 2. The colors do not show up bright after a few uses with the markers. 3. On the 4x3 board, it bends in the middle (4' part), due to not enough support. I really wanted to like the black board for it's looks, but it is functionally unusable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Custer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy magnetic
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic board, although it’s looking great, it’s not magnetic. Please see video. So overall I would give 4 starts for designe, but only one for functionality. Also, buy some heavy duty anchors drywall bolts to install since the board is heavy and the bolts included don’t hold the board well.
customer_reviews.author: Marta Bogna Scigala

customer_reviews.title: Great, Econimcal Priced Glass Board
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office at my work and everyone "oohs" & "ahhs" about it. It was about twice the price of a traditional whiteboard, but the quality and the wow factor far outweighs the extra cost. If you need a good marker, then I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: ESVKTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to hang. Looks really nice. But the biggest flaw is that it sits an inch away from the wall, and when you write on the center of the board, it flexes. There's no support in the center. If this purchase had been my decision, I'd be returning it for something that has stability and won't flex all over the place. This problem could be fixed quite simply with a few rubber feet in the middle, but what a pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky T

customer_reviews.title: i bought two more on a repurchase
customer_reviews.text: i have an 8' x 4' quartet hanging in my kitchen and absolutely love it. no my kitchen is not big, the board takes up the entire wall... and almost everybody falls in love with it when they see it for the first time. i was going to do the whole chalkboard wall paint thing, but decided to try the much classier frameless whiteboard. i was so completely satisfied with my purchase that i bought two more 6' x 4' boards for my workshop brainstorming sessions. as for the brainstorming sessons, just fill the whiteboard with ideas, take a picture when done, and voila, thought's captured:)
customer_reviews.author: real personal user honest review

customer_reviews.title: Cheap glass, good concept
customer_reviews.text: This is the second board I have received, one for work, one for home. Both Quartet 3x4 magnetic glass boards are etched with pits in the glass. The pits are small but it’s enough to make it a pain to erase. Really wish the glass was good quality. Part of the reason for getting glass is smooth and easy erasing for years to come. Not so here. Also, the anchors are small for the weight. I would like to see larger anchors. One out of the four stripped when mounting and I was careful.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great bored, but the hardware sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Step one to mounting this board is throw the provided wall anchors into the garbage. Congratulations, you're already ahead o the game. Go to your local hardware store and buy some drywall anchors that aren't hot garbage. Have a friend hold the glass in place so you can mark all the holes while the glass is level. A template would be handy, unless you're a big guy like me that's practiced juggling 3 hands worth of things on a regular basis have a friend help. Drill holes for your anchors and use the rest of the provided hardware. Other than the anchors and the poor instructions this seems to be good glass, expo neon markers work swell.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sievers

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy. This is a cheaply made product and my white board literally exploded off my wall.
customer_reviews.text: This product literally exploded on my wall. I have video of the glass exploding at random. For people buying this product, I bought the largest whiteboard offered and I always thought it was flimsy...secured on wall, but wobbly when I wrote on it. I loved the size but never would expect it to break like this. Literally glass everywhere and nothing hit it and it didn’t fall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good board, but logo is an eyesore
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very well packaged. Easy to mount by myself. The mounting hardware is more than enough to attach the glass firmly to the wall. Removed stars for the "quartet" logo being embossed in what seems to be some sort of ceramic lettering. I mounted my board vertically, so the logo would have also been vertical and an eyesore. I was able to remove the logo after much trouble. With a combination of razor blade, oil, baking soda, and a bit of elbow grease, the logo was able to be removed enough to not see any more. If the logo would be an easily removable sticker, this would have gotten 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: EricM

customer_reviews.title: The markers do not have bright visibility on board
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item about 3 months ago and just installed it in my office two days ago. The problem with this board is the white mark that came with the board was dry and unusable. Also, I have tried a number of markers on this board and none are visible as indicated on the product information offered by the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed parts; screws provided are too tight for the anchors.
customer_reviews.text: The screws are way too tight for the anchors provided in the packaging. When we installed the anchors to the wall, and then fed the screw through, it resulted in the anchor spinning with the screw. This made the hole bigger. We had to hire someone to install because we had to repurpose the hole, instead of having to patch it. The handyman used a reverse arrow type anchor for the larger hole that was created. This was too much hassle than it should've been. The parts provided with the packaging is poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Balaji

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic aspect is very weak
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the magnetic part, its a sleek looking whiteboard but you have to have very thin, lightweight magnets in order to work which is super disappointing. We could not hang any paper because the only magnets we had that would stick through the glass were too weak to hold up paper.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Campeau

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Takes two people to put install but had to purchase stronger wall supports to mount into beams to guarantee the glass does not fall. So far it has been lovely. I have left the board fully covered with various color writings and erased over a week later with ease. Great product. My only issue was my board was a slightly damaged, along with some of the nails. Clearly someone purchased and returned without using. It was not enough for me to return and start order process all over again. Overall, it’s been better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Texlin Quinney

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely WORTHLESS - NOT MAGNETIC AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, but has almost ZERO magnetic adhesion. NONE. TRIED 30 magnets - every one I had - NONE stick to it!!! will return replace or throw out. I spent hours mounting this thing and even put LED lights behind it...only to find out that it is not magnetic except if you have a 5lb neodymium magnet, forget it!!!
customer_reviews.author: NYpirate

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking board! Not as white as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This board is sleek looking, and cleans easily. The mounting hardware could be better, but I had no issues mounting the board with what was provided. The board itself is very sturdy, and I have not experienced any bending when writing on it. Nor did I experience any streaks when cleaning it. The color is not completely white. You can see a white paper in the picture as reference. Nonetheless, I'm happy with the color. The board only comes with 1 black marker, and 2 magnets. Nothing else. I wish it'd include an eraser! I think that if you're in the market for a glass dry easer board, you won't be disappointed with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Elfrank

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful white board alternative
customer_reviews.text: So much nicer looking that the old school aluminum framed 3x2 white board. My wife wasn’t happy with me ordering a whiteboard for our home office until she saw it and was won over. Frosted glass and brushed metal mounts are modern and very attractive. Comes with one black marker and a tray that can be positioned for either vertical or horizontal mounting. Only item I didn’t like were the plastic wall anchors. Had to swap one out with a butterfly style anchor. Overall very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shane E.

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase even worse!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Bought a second one in frosted glass color for my office and the frosted back was all scratched up and had a second print of the brand name about two inches above the intended one. Not the lack of quality I would expect for a $60 glass white board. Love the glass board but the mounting system did not hold up more than a year. It’d be nice if they sold replacement kits for the mounting system.
customer_reviews.author: Shelbea

customer_reviews.title: It suits the modern design of my office...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It looks classier than the average white board and suits my modern office design. But, it's really heavy and awkward to carry. I had to have it professionally installed. In the reviews I read that the magnets did not work, but they do. Overall good product. A regular white board would have been less expensive and easier to install---but you can't beat the look of this one.
customer_reviews.author: ANW

customer_reviews.title: Great white board, directions are a joke
customer_reviews.text: We have successfully installed the board, however the instructions (or lack thereof) are a joke. You should be comfortable knowing about how to install on drywall vs wood studs vs cement before attempting to install. The wall anchors chewed up our drywall and didn’t really take, but we were able to install with just the screws. Once mounted it looks great and it seems secure. I do think for a consumer product it should have clearer directions (and we’ve self installed a lot of things)
customer_reviews.author: K. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Good looking with not so good hardware
customer_reviews.text: Good looking board, but has flaws. First of all, it did not come with a wall install template like Audio-Visual direct boards do. Having no template made the install process longer and possibly error prone if not very careful. The anchors are not very good. Please do drill a good size initial hole, prior to screwing in the anchor it comes with. The install guide just say to screw in the anchor with no mention of the hole. After having installed both brands in last 2 weeks, I will go with the above mentioned brand anytime. No Quartet again.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Purchase additional mounting screws
customer_reviews.text: The marker board is great, love everything about it. A major recommendation I would make is to purchase some actual construction screws for the mounting. The screws that come with are cheap metal with a Phillips head; needless to say fastening this into studs resulting in me stripping out 3 of the screws and snapping the head off of one. Granted, I was using an impact driver for this, however, I would simply purchase so fasteners with a star head. I have converted all of my fasteners to such, and am very happy with how it turned out.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: The product is as described by the seller!
customer_reviews.text: I am not going to talk about the product coz I couldn't find anything that I should highlight that product description and other users has written. I would mention how I mounted the board to the wall. This is a two-man job (my board is 4x3). 1. First, put the board on the wall, level it and draw circles on the wall using the holes on the board 2. Then drill the middle of the circle. 3. I didn't use the wall plugs came with the board. I didn't find them solid for some reason. Thats it!
customer_reviews.author: WUCV

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, stylish, modern. Looks great, works great. Stand-offs are junk though
customer_reviews.text: I got a 2x3 one in black. Absolutely love it, just wish i had more wall space and could've gotten a bigger one. However mine was slightly damaged. Inside packaging was torn and a streaking scratch on the face. Amazon issued me a refund for it, so I got the thing for free. Hopefully when I am able to order a large one it won't be damaged. Also the standoffs are wimpy. Feels like that super cheap plastic. The manufacturer should really spend a few more pennies and beef those up.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Product poorly made
customer_reviews.text: We would not only not recommend, we will be replacing this board as soon as possible. Extremely disappointing. Ordered this glass Quartet board for our office to replace a glass Quartet board already in place. We made sure the new board was the same size for ease of installation. Unfortunately, the pre-drilled holes in the new board are not even close to the previous board. In fact, they aren't straight and are very poorly drilled. Very suspect manufacturing for one of the most expensive (and most well-known) boards available.
customer_reviews.author: beautifulday

customer_reviews.title: The medium is the message.
customer_reviews.text: The 8x4 magnetic glass is the king of dry-erase boards. There is enough space to express your entire point without the interruption of erasure or muddling of smeared markers. Your audience — students, clients, team — will be impressed with your presentation. Mounting the board is a project. Don't even try to set the 8 bolsters by measuring. I built a sturdy shelf for the board to rest, with the mounting hardware set in the glass. A temporary 2x4 screwed to wall could also suit this purpose. Then it all works on the first try.
customer_reviews.author: Longboat

customer_reviews.title: Hardly magnetic but great whiteboard.
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes this whiteboard, the one drawback on this is that it can hardly be called magnetic. The magnets it comes with hardly adheres to the board and when he tries to put any sort of paper underneath the magnet, it just won’t hold up. We have a lot of powerful magnets in the house we tried using but the board itself is hardly magnetic so it didn’t make a difference with what kind of magnet was used. My husband is considering buying a cork board since this just won’t hold anything magnetically.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Family

customer_reviews.title: It's good, it's a very simple product... Mounting is ehh
customer_reviews.text: It's what most people would expect. It's nice quality glass. Mounting it isn't the easiest thing and I recommend straight into studs when possible (even if you get a 2 ft and can only get one side - use their method for the other side). Why? I always try to mount to studs and this is quite a bit heavier than a picture of same size. Oh, directions.... Please! If you can't figure out how to mount it on your own... The directions will not help you much :). Remember "2" rubber washers on each mount (both sides of glass) you'll think you only got 1 per mount... Stuck together..... I'd probably give it 4.5... but it ain't quite 5
customer_reviews.author: Stay at Home Dad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality with no residual artifacts, but distinct shadow when viewing on an angle
customer_reviews.text: We bought this board after having multiple painted surface whiteboards which wore out and couldn't be erased after long-term usage (2 years or so). We are hoping that with glass, this won't be a problem. Very clean writing with typical dry erase markers. Erases very cleanly as expected with glass. The only thing we had to get used to is that the glass is a few millimeters think, and there is an distinct reflective shadow of whatever is written when you look at it from a slight angle, which is often. You get used to it and it is a minor irritation. But at least now, the markers erase perfectly with no residue left behind.
customer_reviews.author: mejon

customer_reviews.title: Not Magnetic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my classroom to use with a calendar/go over the day with my students. I bought a paper calendar along with magnetic sheets and super-strong magnetic push-pins. None of the magnets worked except the two that came with the board. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Daralyn

customer_reviews.title: Good board, crappy installation hardware...
customer_reviews.text: Board quality is pretty good. Good design, decent glass, okay (not great) magnetism. Installation was a different story. Mounting holes were not at all forgiving which meannt you had to drill just right. Wall anchors were cheap quality and stripped while I was screwing into the wall. Ended up having to swap out the anchors for better quality ones I bought separately. All in all the product is decent. They just need to fix the Installation pains...
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: So this thing is a massive sheet of frosted glass with a thin metal sheet on the back. As others have mentioned, the metal sheet is not thick enough to make any magnets stick really well. Other than that my only gripe would be that the holes aren't quite spaced right for a wall that has standard spaced studs. So when I mounted it, I centered the middle mounts directly on a stud and used the drywall anchors at the corners. Seems good enough. Markers don't flow like they do on a melamine board but I prefer the glass experience overall. Glass markers work great as long as you properly load the writing tip with ink.
customer_reviews.author: JuanBerenguer

customer_reviews.title: The black version is not very efficient
customer_reviews.text: The Quartet boards are awesome, I have probably 6 of them in different sizes and am a big fan. My one caveat is the black version of the board is not what I hoped it would be. I'd never used the chalk markers and they proved to be a pain to deal with. Hard to erase so not good for work type board use. We turned it into a chalk marker design of our business logo and use it as a display piece but that was not the intent.
customer_reviews.author: TateD

customer_reviews.title: Do not use an electric drill!  Also have at lease three people for installing it.
customer_reviews.text: My first board shattered into - not kidding - a million pieces. We had cuts in the walls, molding and our hands. The directions to install are vague. DO NOT USE AN ELECTRIC DRILL. This should be written all over the directions. It’s not mentioned. The company replaced it and it is fine now. It takes some scrubbing to get the markers off but overall am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware Quality Issues
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this whiteboard as it could have been such a great buy with some basic quality control. Upon unboxing, the first thing I noticed was a layer of fine glass dust covering the entire surface. I removed it from the box and cleaned the glass with a soft damp cloth hoping for the best. I then discovered several scratches in the glass and a small white chip in the upper right corner. Back in the box it went, and the worst part is that the glass dust irritated my lungs and has caused lingering respiratory issues. Quartet, I expect better!
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Received in a good condition box so delivery handler did alright. However looks like Quartet's quality control is not the greatest. The board is completely intact but the top corners were not finished properly. The white behind the glass is peeled off in some areas and you can see through the front of the board. I hope I can return this but I'll be looking at alternatives for sure.
customer_reviews.author: The Big Game

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Office Add-In
customer_reviews.text: You’re getting what you pay for when it comes to the board itself, the quality is immaculate. It is so sleek and modern. It holds up really well and doesn’t budge. I bought the eraser and marker pack that unfortunately does not come with the board. It is very easy to clean. The markers are decent but not always the most consistently pigmented and require a lot of shaking sometimes. The attachment tray falls off occasionally, especially when given a bump of the hand or something. Other than that, this is a great addition to an office or workspace of any sort.
customer_reviews.author: Asma

customer_reviews.title: Too much surface wobble in the middle;  lacks support
customer_reviews.text: We bought 4 of these for the conference room and while they look nice and clean up easily, the mounting blocks create an unsupported center. People that are "hard writers" will find that the board will bow to where you think it might snap. Wiping the board turns into a trampoline. We ended up using the Styrofoam packing material to shove behind the glass to make the surface more stable.
customer_reviews.author: FigmentReality

customer_reviews.title: Once finally received, it fits the bill.
customer_reviews.text: So I left a prior review that was not stellar. It took a long time to get this item and when I received it, the box was way too flimsy to ship something this heavy and fragile in. The box was busted and the mounting hardware was missing. I contacted the seller and they made sure I was shipped new hardware. I have since mounted it and it’s fabulous. It’s very nice quality and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Lora K

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, sophisticated, practical, well engineered, long life.
customer_reviews.text: The glass writing surface is the easiest to erase, and clean. And the metal backer makes it strong while providing the ability to use magnets. When installing on masonary or uneven surfaces, use a 1x3inch wood furring strips running vertical. They should be 2 inches shorter than the board height (46" in this case). Attach the furring strips to the wall first. Then install the metal mounts to the strips using #8 x3/4inch wood screw. You will love this board. I have used all three board finishes and the white is my favorite. The marker holder is well constructed and rigid when mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Keisler

customer_reviews.title: Looks good :) Hardly magnetic :(
customer_reviews.text: I have to use the strongest magnets to get anything to stick to this board. Even the supplied magnets can't even hold up a concert ticket stub or small thin piece. Being magnetic was one of the reasons I paid for this item. If you plan on putting any fridge magnets or pieces of paper to this board, make sure you buy extra strong magnets.
customer_reviews.author: eskimozach

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful unit. Few things to bring up
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful unit. Few things to bring up. Instead of holding the heavy board up it is easier to mark the holes on the packaging cardboard and level it up. Be sure to align it properly with the glass while marking it. Other thing, the screws supplied are too long to fit in the anchors and I myself wouldn't trust those cheap plastic wall anchors. I used metal one's, the one's which expands inside of the drywall. Other than that it is a nice board for the conference room.
customer_reviews.author: Milan

customer_reviews.title: You will love your glass whiteboard once its up on the wall but needs some effort installing
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Looks beautiful & classy once you install it on the wall. 2. Easy to write and erase. 3. Modern and perfect writing surface and magnetic surface works well. Cons: 1. Very heavy and you need two people to lift, assemble and install this. 2. A template was provided to help with install. Make sure you take exact measurements. If you fail at this step then your board won't align, you will have a nightmare. 3. Install hardware/ process and the weight of the board - all these areas need improving from the manufacturer. Overall very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality, writing not vivid, and does not accept return
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is very bad. Writing on the glass is not vivid at all and is very difficult to understand unless you stand really close to it. Even when you are stand close, the writing will look very light even though you are using a new marker. Totally dissatisfied with the item and wanted to return. But surprisingly the seller does not accept return which is very surprising. I would recommend not to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Fahim

customer_reviews.title: Painful to install, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Love the look. Reviews are accurate of the slight bluish green tint, not true pure white. Installing it on the wall was difficult. I love it though. The magnets that come with it are extremely strong when on a standard surface, but using it on the whiteboard, I was surprised how weak the magnet was. Don’t think you’ll be able to use any standard magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Ray

customer_reviews.title: Needs better mounting hardware - Included drywall anchors are useless.
customer_reviews.text: The Glass Board came very well packaged. I'm using this dry erase board for online video classes. I like the clean fit and finish and the pricing was about right for this size. The only complaint I have is with the hardware - The drywall anchors did not have any relief cuts, thus when I tried to screw the screws into the anchors they would not secure the anchor - They would only spin and freeze. I would suggest getting some metal anchors from HD - I have included pictures for reference. A set of 2 of these anchors cost $2.74 (100lb rated).
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Deal when on sale!!!
customer_reviews.text: I literally could not be happier. I’ve been looking for a piece of glass this size for a very long time. The glass is tempered so it’s strengthened. It was super easy to assemble (even for me and I struggle putting anything together). Also, it wasn’t too heavy so my father and I were able to lift it easily to line up the holes and mount it perfectly on the wall. I was able to purchase this on sale for over 60% off through amazing. Absolutely incredible deal!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua West

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Frustrating Shipping/Delivery Issues
customer_reviews.text: The Glassboard itself is a great product - easy to install and looks professional. This review is to address the delivery issues with this product. The glassboard arrived smashed once it was finally delivered nearly a month after ordering. The seller has a freight company deliver and WILL NOT help you with scheduling delivery. The buyer has to contact the freight company to schedule delivery which takes a 20 minute call every time. Delivery was scheduled 5 times over two weeks due to the freight company FAILING to deliver when they said they would. Save yourself time and frustration and order this through one of the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Facilities Manager

customer_reviews.title: 6x4 magnetic glass 👍
customer_reviews.text: Great quality - beautiful & sturdy. No defects. It was a bit of a challenge to install; heavy and awkward with very little tolerance for measuring mistakes. We followed other reviewers' advice and made a template from the cardboard piece inside the box and upgraded the hardware (just the screws and anchors). Also as others have noted, the magnetic properties are pretty weak - we probably just won't use magnets. Could've saved $70 or so 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: JoshNJess

customer_reviews.title: defective glass
customer_reviews.text: Defective glass -- had to return it While you can mount it vertically, the quartet logo will be on its side, looking stupid
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Needed
customer_reviews.text: I received this beautiful Whiteboard/Black Surface w/out any hardware. The board itself is beautiful and I look forward to the opportunity to hang it up. Perhaps the company can improve on quality control to reduce packagaining errors. Update: Company sent hardware. After my request, they did send it via expedite shipping. There's no instructions on how to hang the board, so I will explore some of the reviews to find out the proper way to hang it However, again, the board is beautiful plus great quality; I can't wait to start using it. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MathGirl

customer_reviews.title: Magnets don't work!
customer_reviews.text: The whiteboard is pretty nice, but I bought this one so that it was magnetic as well. I'm highly disappointed in the level of magnetism. Even with really strong magnets, they can't hold. The only ones that work are the dry eraser for the same brand, and small magnet that came with the whiteboard. Even with that, the one that came with isn't strong enough to hold a piece of paper. Great whiteboard, but don't buy this for the magnetism, i.e., buy a cheaper one!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Horn

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking whiteboard, not so easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This whiteboard looks nice but it's not easy to install. It's heavy, there is no "wiggle" room and there is no mounting template included. The 6 metal risers that secure the glass to the wall have to be mounted very precise and there is no paper template included to mark the 6 holes. The glass is very heavy and one person can not hold it up flat against the wall to mark the holes. A simple paper template would have made all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Great Board! More Glossy Than Typical Melanine Whiteboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great board! This was an great price for a magnetic, glass whiteboard. I did not need one that was too large and I also did not want one that was subject to wear like a melamine whiteboard. One thing I am divided about, and is no fault of the manufacturer, is the glossiness of the whiteboard. From some angles, the text is not quite as readable as a melamine whiteboard due to the glossiness of the glass. Something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I truly love this board. Every one that comes over marvels at how nice it is. I let them draw on it and its all they can talk about for a while. I use versa chalk markers available her on amazon. good strong packing. no damage on delivery and very high quality materials hard ware. Could easily put this in your kitchen (goes well with black glass stove) or an executive board room and it would look perfect in any setting.
customer_reviews.author: SammyP

customer_reviews.title: be aware, green cast of 'whiteboard', more
customer_reviews.text: i was aware of this phenomenom, so it didn't really bother us, but just be aware that 'white' is not 'white'. also, the instructions are abysmal, as is the marginal hardware. (thank god for the reviews, with ideas, and instructions) i used the amazon installation service...first time with home services....it was a bit rocky, but ultimately they got the job done. they are , fyi, here in miami, DISH installation guys, who do this also. they were adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Writes very well and erases great though! As others have mentioned
customer_reviews.text: For such an expensive piece of glass, you'd expect them to get the color right, but no. The glass used has a greenish tint and is definitely NOT white. If given a true "white" board, I would definitely rank the product 5 stars. Writes very well and erases great though! As others have mentioned, installation is tricky! Make sure you plan out and mark everything first. Having another person help makes a big difference for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Scratches even with the replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I am a person who likes to give 2nd chances. The first time the scratch was larger (the white paint on the back side was scratched... see 1st picture). The 2nd time, the item had a scratch, but smaller (shown in my 2nd picture in this review. ---- Who has time for all this shipping? --- I expect more quality control from Quartet. I will now keep the item and mount it in my office for all to see the scratch by Quartet.
customer_reviews.author: SRooke, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Not magnetic for everyday magnets
customer_reviews.text: Big whiteboards are cool, but advertising them as magnetic when they are BARELY magnetic and charging x3 the price of a normal, is not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Daved1031

customer_reviews.title: Junk Anchors
customer_reviews.text: Trash anchors screwed up my wall. Two of the four anchors popped through the wall because the cap didn't break. I have to go buy real bigger anchors to cover the trash that is my wall now. I'm so pissed right now. You make this product which is a good product and COMPELTELY destroy the experience with the cheapest junk anchors made. 2 OF 4 PUNCHED THROUGH THE WALL... Unbelievable..
customer_reviews.author: Just Another IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Came Quick, but was damaged
customer_reviews.text: The whiteboard arrived quickly. However, the whiteboard had yellow blotch stains. I have attached photos to prove the stains exist. The yellow stains are very noticeable in person and not as noticeable in the photos. I have requested a return. I would NOT recommend purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Decent board, not a real Quartet branded product.
customer_reviews.text: Installed today. Zero "Quartet" branding anywhere. Have installed a few genuine versions of these. The hardware is not as nice. The metal backing is not well trimmed and even cut one of our hands. I believe these to be knock offs. Discovered after installation, so we will have to keep them. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Fellowship Bible Church

customer_reviews.title: Frosted surface - looks nice but colored markers don't show up that well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 4x3 frosted surface non magnetic for my home office. It definitely looks better than a traditional white board. I ordered the Quartet markers, and they work fine with the board - no complaints, wipes off easily and leaves the board clean. My only complaint is that the markers don't show up ("pop") as well as I'd hoped. I mostly just end up using the black marker, which shows up fine. If I could do it again, I would try the white one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost the hardware that comes with it limits your mounting capabilities if the builder did not install the studs property. Second the magnet is not strong enough on this board, it is cheap quality. I have 4 other magnetic Boards that can hold my magnetic markers and holder trays, but this one they slide right down.
customer_reviews.author: Muneer Baig

customer_reviews.title: Clean Erase?  I think not.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this board installed for two days and have been writing with the recommended Quartet Glass Board Marker and see that it leaves ghost imaging all over the board when you erase. It looks terrible! Perhaps if I use cleaning chemical it will all come off, but I have seen other glass whiteboards that when you erase it all comes off and you don't need to use a chemical. It's a thin glass with a metal backing, but it does flex when using. You don't notice it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the look of this product - But it has defects
customer_reviews.text: Got this unit installed today and before I even got it on the wall, I noticed some defects. It looks like the black coating on the back of the glass had some scratches before they attached the metal backing for the magnets to stick to. See the photos. There is also small scratches on the face of the glass. It's unfortunate that one needs to pay so much money for a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Nickski

customer_reviews.title: Buy your own mounting hardware
customer_reviews.text: Overall a disappointment. Mounting it was unnecessarily difficult. It should have come with a template - take the time to make your own, as it has very low tolerance for error. The included mounting hardware is terrible, but drywall anchors are cheap, so I just used my own. Once mounted, there's not much wrong with it, though the magnetic properties are weak - I have an eraser that holds two pens, but it will not stick with pens inside.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Glass Board
customer_reviews.text: Had to return because it was to big for what I needed but I donated to the kids club at the school and they love it. Mounting system is really big screws but you need it because it's heavy. Very modern instead of the ugly white board I settled on😩
customer_reviews.author: Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Love the look, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The black whiteboard absolutely really stands out in my office. Between the board and the markers I use, it definitely adds some good color to the office. The installation is pretty straightforward and easy, although you might want to consider using your own anchors as the ones included seem a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Bizzburple

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic? Uh, yeah, that’s a NO.
customer_reviews.text: I am supremely disappointed with the magnetic ability of this board- which for me, was the biggest selling point. I thought that the included magnets were just low quality, so I tried heavy duty extra strength magnets With one on all four corners on an 8 1/2 x 11 piece of standard printer paper it has and extreme week hold, and slides down the board.
customer_reviews.author: somethingclever

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy but it mounts fine to the wall.
customer_reviews.text: I freakin love this thing. Yes, it's heavy and big but if you mount it correctly, this thing is awesome. I use Neon markers from penguin art supplies and it works great. I also always have some baby wipes handy if I really want the board clean. It's not for everyone but I would recommend this to anyone who works at home like myself and likes to write things down while working.
customer_reviews.author: ss2985

customer_reviews.title: Good board.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great white board for smooth writing and easy erasing. Better than others I have had in the past. My husband mounted this to the wall by himself without any problems. The marker that came with the board works better on this board than other brand markers I have tried. It did arrive with a very small area of "white" missing from the corner -but for me it was not enough of an issue to bother going through a swap. Very pleased. Seems to be good quality so far. I've been using it for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but POOR QUALITY - not worth your time!
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea, however, the board is poor quality. I ordered in black color. The board has a lot of scratches and areas without the color which make it looks terrible. I wanted to give a try and contact customer service to replace it - VERY UNPROFESSIONAL customer service. I returned entire order (board + accessories). Definitely NOT recommended; hopefully another company will come up with better quality products because the idea is amazing. Regards, FORMER Customer
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: This glass board is horrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: This glass board truly is horrible. It is magnetic but hardly any magnet will stay on it unless it’s an extremely strong magnet. The markers are barely visible and that is only the white one. The colored markers are not visible at all. You can’t even distinguish which color you are using.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Holmes

customer_reviews.title: safety hazard
customer_reviews.text: after mounting it on the wall for 2 years, it suddenly crashed by itself last week into 10 thousand pieces. Many of them were found on the ground as far as 20 feet away, so you can imagine the "explosion". Luckily no one was in that room when it happened. Had to spend >1 hour to clean all the mess...
customer_reviews.author: Jian Jin

customer_reviews.title: Has a bit of board flex when pushed down too hard
customer_reviews.text: The mounting was straightforward and it looks pretty sleek! My only complaints after using it for a while are that the marker tray that comes with the board falls off a lot which can become irritating (pretty minor) and the board flexes a bit once you start writing on the sides of the board. Since there are only top and bottom mounting positions, the board flexes quite a bit once you start pressing on the board towards the middle line of it on the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Brown

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful with Caveats
customer_reviews.text: Looks amazing. writes amazing with paint markers. NOT very magnetic. The magnets included are pretty weak and the magnet within the quartet dual eraser does not stick well. Doesn't seem like theres enough metal behind the glass.
customer_reviews.author: CHRINC

customer_reviews.title: Please don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I am a very visual learner. In my profession, I am required to draw illustrations. I use writing surfaces to iterate my thought process and later create professional presentations on my computer. I was so excited to buy this board. I did not realize that this will reflect everything in the room like a mirror. Nothin I write on it is easily readable because of this. And the online retailer's won't take it back for an exchange (frosted or white). I will not recommend this board for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Murali N.

customer_reviews.title: Manufacture Defect
customer_reviews.text: Received the marker board yesterday. Opened today to find (2) chipped defects in the middle of the marker board. NOT damaged during shipping. This is not eligible for return, so unfortunately will have to use anyway. The chips are right in the middle, so you can not tell me whomever packaged this did not see the chips and packaged it anyway and put foam over to hide it. Love the looks of the board otherwise, but not sure how I will hide the chips in when hung and goes in a meeting room. Will not order this type of product again.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Cheap mounting parts
customer_reviews.text: Would have probably been a good dry-erase board but the mounting equipment is very cheap. The plastic dry-wall mounts strip easy even at my drill's lowest torque setting and pre-drilling a large enough hole. I also managed to snap the head off of one of the screws. So now I have a dry-wall mount permanently stuck in my wall. Ended up just throwing this in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Fine as long as you use a dark marker
customer_reviews.text: I really love the design of the board,: glass, modern look. Mounting it was fairly easy. They provide with a template for the holes. I bought some of the glass dry erase markers, but only the darker colors (blue/black) display dark enough. The other colors' (red/green) writing is muted. So, I use the blue and black most of the time. Overall, I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Cox Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy from start to end.
customer_reviews.text: What a classy addition to my personal office over the traditional “white boards”. Not sure why people complain about mounting hardware. Those zip it anchors are more than strong enough to hold that glass. I have used them tons with no worries. The board is fantastic. My coworkers are envious. Writes good. Erases good. Tray mounts perfect. You MUST know how to use a tape measure and level. I had help lifting the glass to mount but other wise a one person job. A++++
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M.

customer_reviews.title: Board is nice... was definitely opened previously
customer_reviews.text: The package was pretty beat up, and looked like it had been opened and repackaged previously. Supporting that was the fact that the hardware was marked up, and several pieces were missing. I had to run to the hardware store to pick up extra rubber washers to install, and the end caps for the tray were missing (didn't plan on installing that anyways, so didn't care too much). That said, quality of the board is nice, and looks great against my office wall.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Raines

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful board and a very easy one to clean.
customer_reviews.text: wow, this board is beautiful. I have the 6'x4' and its huge. Mounting it wasn't hard but figuring out where to drill the holes was difficult. I used the cardboard to mark the drill points and I still couldn't get the holes to line up right. Once you mount it, the board is beautiful and writing is easy. The magnet behind the board isn't strong so you need things that are very magnetic to make them stick. Also if you place the board in areas next to a window you might see a second reflection of the things you right on the board (not an issue for me though).
customer_reviews.author: ባሩካሱ

customer_reviews.title: great board...needs support in the middle
customer_reviews.text: Great board, markers look crisp and legible on the glass surface. This is a genuine quartet board, and at a fraction of my local office supply chain. board includes mounting feet, anchors a couple of magnets and tray. My only caveat is that the board bounces as you move towards the center. I would recommend mounting some kind of support behind the board in the center.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking board with some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Good - nice modern look Bad - scratches between glass and metal (manufacturing defect; not shipping); too much of a hassle to send back - messed up delivery time (nothing to do with product, but still annoying) - provided hardware is not very sturdy; contractor picked something stronger at the hardware store Be mindful - it is really heavy and requires at least two people to install. I recommend using a professional
customer_reviews.author: W. Lo

customer_reviews.title: Discoloration around edges after mounting.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to mount this whiteboard in our home office. Unfortunately, there is a line of discoloration around the edges between each of the mounting parts that began approx. 2 months after being mounted. It started in the lower left corner (pictured) but has extended around the entire board. We contacted Quartet to give them an opportunity to rectify this and they did not respond. I am so sad about the coloring on it because we love having the white board in our office but the discoloration is unsightly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Mirt

customer_reviews.title: The anchors are junk
customer_reviews.text: I installed the glass board and the anchors that were sent pulled out of the wall and landed on top of my computer monitors. It broke one monitor and cracked the glass board not to mention the damage it did to my wall when it fell. I need someone to contact me and make this right. The holes in the glass board should be positioned where they line up on 16” centers so you can fasten to a vertical stud and not just the Sheetrock
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Couch

customer_reviews.title: Nice to write on, a real pain to hang straight!
customer_reviews.text: Board is lovely to write on. You have to get the ultra strong/rare earth/Quartet specific magnets for anything to stick. Installation was well, let's just say that I'm glad I have a bunch of construction experience and some nice tools. This is not easy to hang straight and really should be able to adjust so it can be leveled without re-drilling screws. I'd recommend buying stronger anchors than what it comes with as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rig Fam

customer_reviews.title: Looks Beautiful.  Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something nicer for my home office than a hanging white board. This item is a quality glass board. Write and erases easily. Classy mounting system. Easy to Install. Just make sure you get your wall fasteners/holes "exactly" in the right place. Do that and it goes up easily. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Great whiteboard, terrible wall anchors
customer_reviews.text: The wall anchors that this comes with are an absolute joke - dangerous even. The weight of the whiteboard caused the anchors to start to pull out of the drywall making the standoffs sag. The anchors are simply not good enough for something this heavy. Get yourself a set of 6 Cobra DrillerToggle 3/16” X 3” anchors from Home Depot. These squeeze the drywall and replace the anchor screws with machine screws that tie the standoff to the anchor behind the drywall. It’d be 5 stars if not for the included anchors.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: One tough board
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of Amazon's damaged package/repackaged deals. When it arrived the entire end of the box was torn open. It somehow made it in one piece. Must have been that "fragile" sticker. Mounting standoffs are garbage. If you use them, the glass will rest against a metal bolt. You're one temperature change away from a shattered board. Replaced them with wood.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: Hard to wipe
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure why my wife purchased this. So hard to erase. If you leave text on it for too long (more than 5mins), it gets even harder to wipe. Definitely wouldn’t recommend for someone who’d like to use it as a teaching tool, or someone who has to write and erase constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Dhara

customer_reviews.title: Becareful the frost is NOT magnetic
customer_reviews.text: While I love the quality, sleekness and modern look of this board, I fail to thoroughly read the description and assumed it was magnetic! True, it is user error but I am grading this based on its quality. Great quality!! The look is great! I wish I bought the magnetic white in stead but too late the holes are already drilled. sigh. defeats the whole purpose of me searching for a magnetic board. but this frost one is very nice although not magnetic. See picture below. Looks like we ended up with a marker board instead of a "magnetic" marker board.
customer_reviews.author: Loving_Parents_baby_and_Pugs

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even take it out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I saw the glass, while still in the package, I saw scratches and in some spots the black was cloudy, so I'm returning this. It appears that this was a return from someone else because the area around the holes in the glass for the brackets looks like it was previously installed. On a positive note, delivery was quick and on time.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: White board is great.  Don't have Amazon install it.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these... one 4x3 and one 4x6. They both look/work great and are really affordable for a nice glass whiteboard. I would definitely recommend them. However, I do NOT recommend Amazon's installation service. Their communication and scheduling isn't good and they don't care at all if the board is really really crooked when they hang it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jason Buys

customer_reviews.title: NOT MAGNETIC, NOT RETURNABLE.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!!!! NOT MAGNETIC! This is advertised as magnetic, but no magnets I own actually stick. (Tried 3 different types!) Also, this item is NOT RETURNABLE!!! Amazon you’ve let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Girl

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome but came with some defects
customer_reviews.text: I had to order 3 times to finally get it. I love the glass whiteboard, it looks awesome in my office, but one side of it seems to be damaged, it is not as smooth surface as the rest of the board, this is upsetting since when I erase that area of the board I does not erase completely and it leaves tiny dots all over that are. It also came with several scratches that could have happened during shipping. Aside from that the board works fine and looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Solano C.
